customer_name: DENNIS VAN WYK DONNA VAN WYK

citations.narrative:
Eight enclosures, housing 12 adult large and small breed dogs and 3 puppies have an excessive buildup of feces. In the
adult dogs enclosures, feces are scattered about most the outdoor floor space and the large breed dogs were seen
stepping in it and had fecal material on their paws. In the enclosure with 3 dachshund puppies, about 50% of the floor
space was covered with dry, matted down feces and puppies were seen sitting on it. The licensee stated that the
enclosures had not been cleaned in a few days and planned to clean them this evening. A buildup of feces could cause
the dogs to become soiled and increase the risk of poor health and disease.
Hard surfaces in contact with dogs must be spot-cleaned daily to prevent the accumulation of feces and reduce disease
hazards.
Correction date: December 6, 2023

An enclosure housing 3 weaned dachshund puppies has an empty water bowl and the puppies can not reach a nipple
water in the enclosure. The puppies water bowl was filled and the puppies took a few licks, but didn't seem very thirsty.
For their health, growth, and well being, weaned puppies must have potable water available at all times.
Potable water must be continuously available to all dogs unless restricted by the attending veterinarian. When using water
bowls, they must secured or checked with sufficient frequency to ensure this requirement is met.
Correction date: The water bowl was filled and fresh water was provided during inspection (06-DEC-2023).
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.1(c)(3) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Eight enclosures, housing 12 adult large and small breed dogs and 3 puppies have an excessive buildup of feces. In the 
adult dogs enclosures, feces are scattered about most the outdoor floor space and the large breed dogs were seen 
stepping in it and had fecal material on their paws. In the enclosure with 3 dachshund puppies, about 50% of the floor 
space was covered with dry, matted down feces and puppies were seen sitting on it. The licensee stated that the 
enclosures had not been cleaned in a few days and planned to clean them this evening. A buildup of feces could cause 
the dogs to become soiled and increase the risk of poor health and disease. 
Hard surfaces in contact with dogs must be spot-cleaned daily to prevent the accumulation of feces and reduce disease 
hazards. 
Correction date: December 6, 2023 
3.10(a) 
   
Watering 
An enclosure housing 3 weaned dachshund puppies has an empty water bowl and the puppies can not reach a nipple 
water in the enclosure. The puppies water bowl was filled and the puppies took a few licks, but didn't seem very thirsty.  
For their health, growth, and well being, weaned puppies must have potable water available at all times. 
Potable water must be continuously available to all dogs unless restricted by the attending veterinarian. When using water 
bowls, they must secured or checked with sufficient frequency to ensure this requirement is met. 
Correction date: The water bowl was filled and fresh water was provided during inspection (06-DEC-2023). 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
